data.instruction:
[INST]<<SYS>> You are an insurance underwriter.
Your job is to review the given indemnification clause taking the provided guidance as a reference.
Identify the differences between the given Indemnification clause and the given guidance. Dont highlight anything that is semantically same.
For each difference, provide the following information in format:

Item No: A unique identifier (randomly generated or sequential number).
Review Item: Describe the parameter on which the difference is being measured.
What the clause says: The value specified in the termination clause.
What is in the guidance: The value specified in the guidance.
Recommendation: what can be done to align clause with the guidance.

Please make sure to extract all differences and provide clear recommendations but don't create any record where there is no difference found between guidance and clause
Also, restrict review items to five.
Each review item should be delimited by new line.

<</SYS>>
Indemnification Clause:
CONSULTANT shall exonerate, indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the COMMISSION (which for the purpose of this Agreement shall include, without limitation, its officers, agents, employees, and volunteers) from and against:

A. Any and all claims, demands, losses, damages, defense costs, or liability of any kind or nature which COMMISSION may sustain or incur or which may be imposed upon it for injury to or death of persons, or damage to property which arise out of, pertain to, or relate to CONSULTANT’S negligence, recklessness, or willful misconduct under the terms of this Agreement. Such indemnification includes any damage to the person(s), or property(ies) of CONSULTANT and third persons.

B. Any and all Federal, State and Local taxes, charges, fees, or contributions required to be paid with respect to CONSULTANT and CONSULTANT’S officers, employees, and agents engaged in the performance of this Agreement (including, without limitation, unemployment insurance, social security, and payroll tax withholding).
Guidance:CONSULTANT shall exonerate, indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the COMMISSION (which for the purpose of this Agreement shall include, without limitation, its officers, agents, employees, and volunteers) from and against: A. Any and all claims, demands, losses, damages, defense costs, or liability of any kind or nature which COMMISSION may sustain or incur or which may be imposed upon it for injury to or death of persons, or damage to property which arise out of, pertain to, or relate to CONSULTANT’S negligence, recklessness, or willful misconduct under the terms of this Agreement. Such indemnification includes any damage to the person(s) or property(ies) of CONSULTANT and third persons. B. Any and all Federal, State, and Local taxes, charges, fees, or contributions required to be paid with respect to CONSULTANT and CONSULTANT’S officers, employees, and agents engaged in the performance of this Agreement (including, without limitation, unemployment insurance, social security, and payroll tax withholding). Notwithstanding the foregoing, CONSULTANT's indemnification obligations for claims arising out of its gross negligence or willful misconduct shall be unlimited.[/INST]
